intro: Metteniusa huilensis, commonly known as the Huilén tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean region of Colombia, specifically the departments of Cauca and Huila. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, montane forests at elevations between 1,200 and 2,500 meters. The tree is valued for its hard, durable wood and has been used traditionally in construction and as a source of medicinal compounds.
